author: Staff Reporter
text:
Dalit Liberation Movement- Tamil Nadu has petitioned National Commission for Scheduled Caste seeking action against Tahsildar (Kangayam) alleging there was a tardiness in issuance of destitute widow certificate to a Dalit woman.

S. Karuppaiah, State joint general secretary of the Movement, told reporters that Vasuki, the Dalit woman, had given an application for the certificate at the office of Revenue Divisional Officer at Dharapuram in December 2015.

Though the RDO has asked a report from the Tahsildar before the issuance of the certificate, the taluk level official is yet to give the report, he said.

“Despite our repeated representations, no action was taken,” he added. When contacted, revenue officials said they would look into the complaint on its merit.
title: Petition submitted
